what: Divisible Content Strategy Gives You More Content With Less Work
title: Why a chart Library?
text: explained blog post, divisible content strategy approach content creation use single asset create multiple pieces. example, might break e-book articles, infographic, social microcontent, even brand video.  chart library therefore designed speed creation microcontent can re-embedded wherever needed.

title: UNHCR Population statistics Database
text: package inspired tutorial @ https://r-pkgs.org/data.html (code used build package data-raw/build.R). Data pulled HDX @ unhcr-population-data--world conveniently packaged R users intending build data stories. Note, can also explore data Refugee Data Finder. package promotes reproducible approaches within UNHCR.UNHCR Staff want learn R, visit UNHCR Learn & Connect- R training.

title: UNHCR Population statistics Database
text: First install UNHCR branding packages R showcased : https://dataviz.unhcr.org/tools/r/

title: UNHCR Population statistics Database
text: package includes series functions provides recipes create re-usable charts line Divisible Content Strategy. functions rendered predefined Report template, aka “Statistical Factsheet” got Countries Regions, generated either PDF Powerpoint presentations. Designers, convenient versions plot svg format (usable Illustrator/Inkscape Indesign/Scribus) can generated directly : unhcrthemes::unhcr_save(plot, "plot.svg"). can also explore Country Statistical Focus, accessible provides visualization country relation 6 dimensions displacement: Categories, Origin, Demographics, Solutions, Processing Source.

title: UNHCR Population statistics Database
text: data presented website consists following dataset: End-year population figures - stock figures specific types populations end year, including refugees, IDPs asylum seekers. Demographics – available UNHCR data, IDMC UNRWA data. demographics available resettlement naturalization data Asylum applications asylum-seekers Asylum decisions taken asylum claims asylum-seekers Solutions – flow figures, total number individuals availed solution year.

title: UNHCR Population statistics Database
text: Details provided dataset data disaggregated year, since 1951 stock figures, type population, country/territory asylum origin. Note term country/territory asylum range contexts depending dataset chosen Resettlement – context country arrival – .e. country refugee resettled Returns – context country departure – .e. country refugee voluntarily repatriated. Country/territory asylum origin – full list UN countries available UNSD methodology page . ISO3 country codes included. UNHCR uses following non-standard ISO3 country codes: UNK Various/unknown STA Stateless

what: Data protection & Statistical Disclosure Risk Treatment
title: UNHCR Population statistics Database
text: publishing statistics refugee statistics website, UNHCR applies safeguards protect confidentiality. Small numbers less five rounded nearest multiple five. Additionally data relating pending asylum applications, new applications decisions rounded five ten. Data tables remains additive therefore totals considered approximations.

title: UNHCR Population statistics Database
text: can submit request new charts Contributions, specifically creation new functions chart library welcome! Please fork, develop within fusen dev markdown dev/flat_full.Rmd submit pull request.

text: data frame 109960 rows 11 variables: Year character Year CountryOriginCode character Country Origin Code isoA3 CountryAsylumCode character Country Asylum Code isoA3 CountryOriginName character Country Origin Name CountryAsylumName character Country Asylum Name REF integer Number Refugees: include individuals recognized 1951 Convention relating Status Refugees, 1967 Protocol, 1969 Organization African Unity (OAU) Convention Governing Specific Aspects Refugee Problems Africa, refugee definition contained 1984 Cartagena Declaration Refugees incorporated national laws, recognized accordance UNHCR Statute, individuals granted complementary forms protection, enjoying temporary protection. refugee population also includes people refugee-like situations.   People refugee-like situation refers category descriptive nature includes groups people outside country territory origin face protection risks similar refugees, refugee status , practical reasons, ascertained. IDP integer Number Internally Displaced Persons: (IDPs) persons groups persons forced obliged flee leave homes places habitual residence, particular result , order avoid effects armed conflict, situations generalized violence, violations human rights natural human-made disasters, crossed internationally recognized State border. purposes UNHCR’s statistics, population includes conflict-generated IDPs Office extends protection /assistance. IDP population also includes people IDP-like situation.    People IDP-like situation refers category descriptive nature includes groups people inside country nationality habitual residence face protection risks similar IDPs , practical reasons, reported . ASY integer Number Asylum-seekers: Asylum-seekers individuals sought international protection whose claims refugee status yet determined. OOC integer Number Others Concern UNHCR: groups persons concern refers individuals necessarily fall directly groups UNHCR extended protection /assistance services, based humanitarian special grounds. STA integer Number Stateless persons: Individuals UNHCR’s statelessness mandate defined 1954 Convention Relating Status Stateless Persons considered nationals State operation law. words, possess nationality State. UNHCR statistics refer people fall organization’s statelessness mandate stateless according international definition. Data countries may also include people undetermined nationality. people lack proof possession nationality time regarded important links one State. UNHCR also works populations risk statelessness, persons risk statelessness reported statistical category individuals UNHCR’s statelessness mandate. OIP integer Number People Need International Protection:  People outside country territory origin, typically forcibly displaced across international borders, reported categories (asylum-seekers, refugees, people refugee-like situation) likely need international protection require protection forced return, access basic services temporary longer-term basis.

unhcrdatapackage 0.1.5
text: Update dataset mid-year 2022 data release (28 Oct 2022) Created dedicated function update_dataset() - see https://github.com/Edouard-Legoupil/unhcrdatapackage/blob/master/dev/flat_full.Rmd Adjusted new statistical categories - related functions - “Host community” = “HCO” - “people need international protection”=“OIP”

title: unhcrdatapackage 0.1.4
